Add r-values and exactly one set of significance stars to a correlations heatmap (pass the full res from PlotCorrelationsHeatmap()).

Source: R/add_r_and_stars.R
add_r_and_stars.Rd

Add r-values and exactly one set of significance stars to a correlations heatmap (pass the full res from PlotCorrelationsHeatmap()).

Usage

add_r_and_stars(
  res,
  star_from = c("existing", "raw", "fdr", "P", "P_adj", "column"),
  star_col = NULL,
  r_var = "R",
  r_digits = 2,
  r_size = 3,
  r_color = "black",
  r_nudge_y = -0.28,
  star_size = 6,
  star_color = "black",
  star_nudge_y = 0.28,
  p_breaks = c(-Inf, 0.001, 0.01, 0.05, Inf),
  p_labels = c("***", "**", "*", "")
)

Arguments

res

List returned by PlotCorrelationsHeatmap()

star_from

One of: "existing","raw","fdr","P","P_adj","column"

star_col

Column used when star_from = "column"

r_var

Correlation column (default "R")

r_digits

Decimal places for r labels

r_size

Text size for r labels

r_color

Color for r labels

r_nudge_y

Vertical nudge for r (negative = below center)

star_size

Text size for star labels

star_color

Color for star labels

star_nudge_y

Vertical nudge for stars (positive = above center)

p_breaks

Cutpoints for p→stars

p_labels

Labels for p→stars

Value

ggplot

On this page
